metadata.title: CVE-2019-15890 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: libslirp 4.0.0, as used in QEMU 4.1.0, has a use-after-free in ip_reass in ip_input.c. It was discovered that a use-after-free vulnerability existed in the SLiRP networking implementation of QEMU. A local attacker in a guest could use this to cause a denial of service.

criterions.comment: basilisk2 package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
bochs package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
fs-uae package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
libslirp package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.0-2').
ns3 package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
qemu package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2-1ubuntu1').
slirp package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
slirp4netns package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.4.1-1').
vde2 package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
virtualbox package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
virtualbox-hwe package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
xen package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
